DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cardiovascular Disorder Corrected QT Interval Risk Factor Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient has a cardiovascular risk associated with corrected QT Interval that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cardiovascular Disorder Corrected QT Interval Risk Factor Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma._The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula._Something that increases the chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer are age, a family history of certain cancers, use of tobacco products, being exposed to radiation or certain chemicals, infection with certain viruses or bacteria, and certain genetic changes._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Cardiovascular Disorder Corrected QT Interval Risk Factor Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.:The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.:Something that increases the chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer are age, a family history of certain cancers, use of tobacco products, being exposed to radiation or certain chemicals, infection with certain viruses or bacteria, and certain genetic changes.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.
The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.
Any aspect of an individual's life, behavior, an environmental exposure, or an inborn or inherited characteristic that increases the likelihood of a disease, condition or injury.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QT interval corrected for heart rate using the Bazett's formula QTcB greater than or equal to 480 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have marked baseline prolongation of QT/QTc interval, e.g., repeated demonstration of a QTc interval greater than 450 msec, or long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex-4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QT interval corrected for heart rate using the Bazett's formula QTcB greater than or equal to 480 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have corrected QT interval calculated by the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than 500 ms within 28 days before randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was corrected QT interval > 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a QTc interval less than 450 ms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the mean resting corrected QT interval (QTc using Fredericia's formula (QTcF)) greater than 470 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have consistent QTc greater than 450 msec for men and greater than 470 msec for women by Fridericia formula, on 3 separate ECGs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a baseline prolongation of the rate-corrected QT interval (QTc) greater than 480 milliseconds or history of congenital long QT syndrome or torsades de pointes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have baseline prolongation of the rate-corrected QT interval (QTc) (e.g. repeated demonstration of QTc interval greater than 480 milliseconds or history of congenital long QT syndrome or torsades de pointes)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have history or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or evidence of cardiovascular risk associated with a QT interval corrected for heart rate using the Bazett's formula QTcB greater than or equal to 480 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QTc (with Bazett's correction) prolongation greater than 470 msec or other significant electrocardiogram (ECG) abnormality noted within 14 days of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QTc prolongation (defined as a QTc interval greater than or equal to 480 msec) or other significant ECG abnormalities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QTc (with Bazett's correction) prolongation greater than 470 msec or other significant electrocardiogram (ECG) abnormality noted within 14 days of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the average of the three most recent QT intervals corrected for heart rate using the Bazett's formula QTcB greater than or equal to 460 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have resting QTc greater than 470 msec on 2 or more time points within a 24-hour period noted within 14 days of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QT interval corrected for heart rate using the Bazett's formula QTcB greater than or equal to 480 msec on screening ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have baseline prolongation of the rate-corrected QT interval (QTc) (e.g. repeated demonstation of QTcF greater than 470 msec or history of congenital long QT syndrome or torsades de pointes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a corrected QT interval calculated by the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than 500 ms within 28 days before randomization?  Note: if initial QTcF is found to be greater than 500 ms, two additional EKGs

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a corrected QT interval calculated by the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than 500 ms within 28 days before randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a mean resting QTc < 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prolonged corrected QT interval by the Fridericia correction formula on the screening electrocardiogram (ECG) greater than 470 msec (as determined on 2 or more time points within a 24 hour period if the first ECG demonstrates a prolonged corrected QT interval)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a resting electrocardiogram (ECG) with QTc greater than 470 msec (as determined on 2 or more time points within a 24 hour period)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a mean resting QTc greater than 470 msec on screening obtained from 3 EKGs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have increased risk of QT prolongation (e.g. from known long-QT syndrome) or  corrected QT interval that is persistently longer than 450ms despite adjustments to other medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have increased risk of QT prolongation (e.g. from known long-QT syndrome) or who have a corrected QT interval that is persistently longer than 450ms despite adjustments to other medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does resting ECG indicate uncontrolled, potentially reversible cardiac conditions, as judged by the investigator (e.g., unstable ischemia, uncontrolled symptomatic arrhythmia, congestive heart failure, QTcF prolongation greater than 500 ms, electrolyte disturbances, etc.), or congenital long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have the mean resting QTc greater than 450 msec on screening obtained from 3 ECGs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have resting electrocardiogram (ECG) indicating uncontrolled, potentially reversible cardiac conditions, as judged by the investigator (e.g., unstable ischemia, uncontrolled symptomatic arrhythmia, congestive heart failure, QT corrected by the Fridericia formula [QTcF] prolongation of greater than 500 msec, electrolyte disturbances) or congenital long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have baseline prolongation of the rate-corrected QT interval (QTc) (e.g. repeated demonstation of QTcF greater than or equal to 470 msec (mean value, obtained from 3 ECGs, using the screening clinic ECG machine derived QTc value) or history of congenital long QT syndrome or torsades de pointes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a Fridericia's formula' corrected QT interval (QTcF) prolongation of greater than 470 ms (females) or greater than 450 ms (males) based on average of the screening triplicate 12-lead ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have QTcF (using the Fridericia correction calculation) greater than or equal to 470 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a corrected QT interval calculated by the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than 470 ms within 28 days before enrollment?

DataElement.administrativeNotes:
7/20/23 removed special character from AQT_mmt
8/5/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
